data.fullContent: At both the federal and state levels, the law of the United States is largely based on the common law system of English law. This was the system of law that was in force at the time of the Revolutionary War. However, American law has changed from its English ancestor both in terms of substance and procedure. American law also borrows ideas from civil law.
data.answer: 在联邦和州一级，美国的法律很大程度上是以英国法的普通法体系为基础的。这是独立战争时期实行的法律制度。然而，美国法律在内容和程序上都与它的英国祖先发生了变化。美国法律也借鉴了民法的理念。
